items.title: Adnoc Gas, TotalEnergies, Gunvor in fray for BPCL's  ₹35,000-crore LNG contract
items.summary: India's refiners and gas supply firms have been actively scouting for long-term gas contracts worldover in a bid to achieve energy security amid an uncertain trade scenario and post Russian major Gazprom's contract renege with India's state-owned Gail in 2022.

items.title: SpaceX, xAI in talks over merger ahead of potential IPO: Report
items.summary: The proposed merger could boost Musk’s push into space-based AI and strengthen SpaceX’s defence credentials, analysts say. SpaceX is valued near $800 billion, while xAI was last valued at $230 billion, with an IPO potentially pushing SpaceX past $1 trillion.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: At Near-full capacity, India needs structural reforms for faster growth, says DK Pant, India Ratings
items.summary: With the economy operating close to capacity, the survey notes that structural reforms will be required to lift the investment rate and further improve total factor productivity to achieve faster growth. It projects real GDP growth for FY27 in the range of 6.8-7.2%, while the Union Budget may assume nominal GDP growth of 9.8-10.2%.

items.title: Economic Survey suggests lowering government stake threshold to 26% to enable further PSU disinvestment
items.summary: The Economic Survey recommends amending the definition of a 'government company' to allow the government to reduce its stake to 26% in listed state-run firms. This move could facilitate further monetization of holdings in blue-chip companies like ONGC and SBI, enabling them to operate as professionally managed entities with dispersed ownership.

items.title: Economic Survey warns against frontier AI chase
items.summary: India should prioritize a bottom-up, sector-specific AI approach over chasing frontier-scale models due to capital and infrastructure constraints, the Economic Survey 2025-26 stated. The survey highlighted entry barriers in AI development and the need to balance data center expansion with resource competition, while also emphasizing AI adoption for manufacturing competitiveness.

items.title: In uncertain world, Economic Survey pushes buffers & backs intelligent swadeshi, says Rajani Sinha, CareEdge
items.summary: The survey also stresses that while policy reforms are essential, process reforms are equally critical, underscoring the need to ease regulatory hurdles and improve the ease of doing business. This assumes greater importance at a time when there is an urgent need to attract both domestic and foreign investment. Global turbulence has heightened risks to capital flows, which could have severe repercussions for the economy. Enhancing India's investment attractiveness is, therefore, imperative.

items.title: Strong macros, weak global rewards: Survey flags new growth paradox, says Dharmakirti Joshi, CRISIL
items.summary: Despite a benign macroeconomic backdrop, persistent capital outflows and sharper depreciation of the rupee against the US dollar present a paradox. In this context, the survey observes, "India's strongest macroeconomic performance in decades has collided with a global system that no longer rewards macroeconomic success with currency stability and capital inflows."

items.title: Bristol Myers moves SC to stop Zydus from selling biosimilar cancer drug
items.summary: US firm Bristol Myers Squibb is in the Supreme Court seeking to halt Zydus Lifesciences from manufacturing and selling a biosimilar cancer drug. The court will hear the appeal on February 4. BMS markets the drug nivolumab under brands Opdivo and Opdyta.

items.title: Gold rally cuts India’s consumption 11% in 2025, coin and bar demand rises: WGC
items.summary: India's gold consumption dipped 11% in 2025 due to soaring prices, with jewellery demand plummeting 24%. However, investors flocked to gold coins and bars, boosting their demand by 17%. Despite the volume drop, the value of gold sales surged 30%. Experts predict continued global uncertainties will keep investment demand strong.

items.title: Formal skilling could boost jobs by 13%, says Economic Survey
items.summary: India needs more formal skill training. The Economic Survey highlights this, suggesting a boost in skilled workers could significantly increase jobs. A unified apprenticeship mission is proposed, combining existing schemes. This aims to streamline training and attract more youth. Industry partnerships and policy reforms are key to building a future-ready workforce.

items.title: Economic Survey turns bullish on growth, cautions on uncertainty: Aditi Nayar, ICRA
items.summary: The revised potential growth estimate also anchors the survey's FY27 growth projection of 6.8-7.2%. It lays out three scenarios mapping global developments and the transmission of uncertainty to the Indian economy, a prudent approach given the scale of external volatility seen in 2025.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: India an oasis of macro stability in a volatile global environment, says CEA
items.summary: The goal is to cut the combined fiscal deficit of the Centre and states to about 6% in the medium-to-long term. The unconditional physical transfers that many states are pursuing today do have a useful short-term role. However, sustaining growth requires careful re-prioritisation within revenue spending by states so that short-term income support does not erode the very investments on which inclusive, medium-term prosperity ultimately rests, says V Anantha Nageswaran.

items.title: Global Business Summit to discuss India’s path to a $10-trillion economy
items.summary: New Delhi will host the ET NOW Global Business Summit 2026 on February 13-14. Policymakers and business leaders will discuss India's ambition to become a $10 trillion economy by 2047. The summit will focus on resilience and growth amidst global trade uncertainties. Discussions will cover strategic defence, semiconductors, clean energy, and digital sovereignty.

items.title: Minimum import price set for Penicillin G, salts
items.summary: The Indian government has imposed a minimum import price on crucial pharmaceutical ingredients like penicillin G, amoxicillin, and 6-APA. This move aims to counter cheap imports from China and support domestic producers. The price restrictions will be in effect for one year. This measure applies to imports for domestic consumption, ensuring a level playing field for local manufacturers.

items.title: Economic Survey: Battery, pumped hydro storage can power clean energy shift
items.summary: By 2030, India's ambition to harness renewable energy hinges on establishing robust energy storage solutions. Innovative battery systems and expansive pumped hydroelectric projects will be essential to balance intermittent energy outputs and maintain grid reliability. Forward-thinking policies and market initiatives are paving the way for this transformation, promising a sustainable and resilient energy future for the country.

items.title: AI is reshaping how audiences discover and engage with content: JioStar’s Kiran Mani
items.summary: AI is revolutionizing content discovery and engagement, making experiences faster, simpler, and more natural for users.  It personalizes recommendations based on real-time behavior, lowers entry barriers for creators, and shifts focus to intelligent, interactive, and conversational media experiences. Success will be measured by meaningful interactions and sustainable creator careers.

items.title: Economic Survey: Pvt capital, climate tech key to fixing farm productivity
items.summary: The challenges facing India's agriculture sector are significant, encompassing issues like fragmented land ownership and vulnerabilities to climate change. To combat these obstacles, the Economic Survey suggests innovative approaches such as adopting climate-smart farming practices and enhancing market connectivity for farmers. There's a crucial need for the private sector to step up in areas like food manufacturing and distribution.

items.title: Economic Survey: Going green & orange, and in the pink of health
items.summary: India's economy is poised for growth with proposed reforms. Opening heritage sites for concerts and easing artist visas will boost the concert economy. MSMEs will get better credit access. E-way bills will be simplified for smoother logistics. Dietary reforms are crucial for public health. Industrial clusters will be modernized. Commodity prices are expected to rise.

items.title: States must back human capital over cash: Economic Survey
items.summary: State governments' cash transfer schemes are straining finances and impacting growth. These popular programs are costing ₹1.7 lakh crore this fiscal year. Fiscal indiscipline by states could increase borrowing costs for the nation. The Economic Survey urges states to prioritize capital and human capital investment over open-ended cash support. This trend raises concerns about fiscal sustainability and future growth prospects.

items.title: Economic Survey: Economic statecraft rewrites trade and technology flows
items.summary: As global unpredictability increases with nationalistic policies on the rise, India stands at a crossroads. To secure its future, the nation must fortify its economic autonomy and bolster manufacturing capabilities. In an era where supply chains and technology are reevaluated for the sake of national security, India should pivot towards self-sufficient tech innovation and enhanced energy infrastructure.

items.title: Dollar under pressure as investors remain jittery over U.S. policy
items.summary: GLOBAL-FOREX/ (UPDATE 5):FOREX-Dollar under pressure as investors remain jittery over U.S. policy

items.title: Trade deals, diversification to strengthen exports momentum
items.summary: India's export scene is on the rise! With promising trade negotiations underway with the United States and fresh partnerships forming around the globe, the outlook is remarkably optimistic. Even in the face of rising global protectionism, India's trade figures have outperformed projections. This acceleration is powered by significant structural reforms and strategic policy initiatives.

items.title: US slams Europe for ‘mother of all deals’ with India, says it undermines Ukraine war efforts
items.summary: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent pointed out that while India had begun buying sanctioned Russian oil, European countries later purchased refined products, effectively funding the conflict.

items.title: First Brands Founder Charged With Fraud That Wiped Out Billions
items.summary: First Brands Group founder Patrick James and his brother Edward, a former executive at the company, were indicted in New York following the collapse of the bankrupt auto-parts maker last year.

items.title: Economic Survey flags strong growth ahead for India’s aviation, ports and shipping sectors by FY31
items.summary: India's civil aviation and ports sectors are poised for substantial growth by FY31, fueled by increasing demand and infrastructure investments. The Economic Survey highlights India's low airport density compared to global benchmarks, indicating significant expansion potential.  Ports are also scaling up, with PPP and captive operators expected to manage 80% of cargo by 2030.

items.title: Blue Owl Investors Pull 15% of Assets From Tech-Focused Fund
items.summary: Investors pulled around 15.4% of net assets from one of Blue Owl Capital Inc.’s tech-focused funds, following the vehicle’s decision to dramatically increase the amount investors could withdraw earlier this month.

items.title: Aadhaar vs Passport: 12 key differences that set 12-digit ID apart from citizenship-bearing booklet
items.summary: Aadhaar and passport are often seen as comparable identity documents, but Indian law treats them very differently. This explainer outlines the legal, verification and citizenship-related distinctions between the two.

items.title: Manufacturing boost: Three cheers for 3-tier Swadeshi approach
items.summary: India can boost domestic manufacturing in key sectors like oils, pulses, and pharmaceuticals. Other areas like battery cells and solar wafers need a gradual approach. The nation should focus on 'intelligent indigenisation' to build resilience and integrate globally. This strategy aims to strengthen manufacturing and lower costs. The focus is on strategic urgency, feasibility, and cost-effectiveness for long-term competitiveness.

items.title: India–US Trade Deal| BTA could be ‘finalised any day now’ as negotiations edge closer: Report
items.summary: The BTA, which was formally proposed in February following directions from the leadership of both countries, aims to more than double bilateral trade from the current USD 191 billion to USD 500 billion by 2030.

items.title: NPAs hit multi-decadal low as banks stay well-capitalised: Economic Survey
items.summary: The survey highlighted that amid global uncertainty, India’s monetary and financial sectors performed strongly in FY26 (April–December 2025).

items.title: Economic Survey suggests need for activity-based financial norms
items.summary: India's Economic Survey proposes a regulatory shift. Regulations should focus on activities and risks, not just institutions. This will ensure fair competition among banks, NBFCs, fintechs, and market lenders. Better coordination between regulators is vital. The goal is to calibrate regulation to risk and contestability. This approach will foster innovation and systemic stability.

items.title: Economic Survey: PPP framework needs focus on market building
items.summary: To propel India's infrastructure development, we must rethink public-private partnerships. According to the Economic Survey, it's time to transition from singular projects to a more cohesive market initiative. This strategy emphasizes innovative funding avenues such as user fees and municipal bonds. Additionally, it outlines a robust project framework and contingency strategies for intricate projects.

items.title: India must shift to entrepreneurial regime, rethink state capacity: Economic Survey
items.summary: India should foster a culture where bureaucrats feel empowered to take bold risks. This mindset can spur innovation and facilitate rapid decision-making, free from the constraints of baseless accusations. Drawing inspiration from East Asian nations, which have successfully developed robust manufacturing industries through similar strategies, India must rethink its state mechanisms and adopt an entrepreneurial lens in policymaking.

items.title: Share of US crude in India’s imports rises to 8.1% in April–November
items.summary: India's crude oil imports from the United States have significantly increased. This rise occurred even as supplies from major sources like Russia, Saudi Arabia, and Iraq decreased. The UAE's share also grew. Smaller producers like Nigeria, Egypt, and Libya saw their contributions rise. Refiners are diversifying sources to manage risks. Commercial factors and discounts remain key to procurement decisions.

items.title: Economic Survey: Rupee fails to score on a placid pitch
items.summary: India's rupee has weakened significantly despite robust economic growth and low inflation. This underperformance is linked to reduced foreign capital inflows and global geopolitical issues. The Economic Survey highlights that the rupee's stability depends on these capital flows. India needs to attract more investment and boost exports to manage its import costs effectively.

items.title: Indian carriers likely to triple fleet size in 10 years, says Airbus
items.summary: The European aerospace giant also expects the regional air traffic in India to grow and further democratise the country's aviation ecosystem. "We generally see the regional market and the regional air traffic as a good opportunity for further growth and also for further democratisation," Westermeier said.

items.title: Eco survey: India Inc must expand footprint in times of trade uncertainties
items.summary: India Inc needs to enhance internal capabilities and diversify risks by reducing single-market dependence. Strategic M&A and partnership models are crucial for integrating into global value chains and navigating trade uncertainties. This approach will bolster resilience against external shocks and foster global competitiveness.

items.title: Macro View: Indian economy to grow steadily, but risks loom, says Economic Survey
items.summary: India's economy is set for robust growth. Projections show a medium-term expansion of around 6.5 percent. This could climb to 7-8 percent with continued reforms. Strong domestic demand and foreign exchange reserves bolster India's resilience. The nation remains a fast-growing major economy. Global risks are present, but India is positioned for stability.

items.title: View: Policymaking in a brave new world
items.summary: India faces a changing global order. The nation must balance growth and stability through reforms.  Productivity enhancements are key for competitiveness and exports.  Careful industrial policy and trade agreements are vital.  The upcoming budget is an opportunity to signal India's readiness for these epochal times.  This is a budget for action.

items.title: Tata Consumer, Danone India deal talks stall over 'strategic' issues
items.summary: Danone had quoted an acquisition cost of $1.2 billion for its entire portfolio, sources said. "It was better to call a halt to deal if strategic decisions were not aligned. Both sides were not aligned on final agreement," said an official. ET had reported in December last year that TCPL had planned to acquire Danone SA's India nutraceuticals and specialised nutrition portfolio as part of its push in the fast-growing wellness and nutrition market.

items.title: Economic Survey: Health warning for states' fiscal metrics
items.summary: State government finances are facing challenges with rising deficits and increased borrowing. While capital expenditure is being supported by central government loans, a rise in unconditional cash transfers is impacting fiscal space. This trend could lead to higher sovereign borrowing costs. Prudent fiscal management by states is not being rewarded with lower borrowing rates.

items.title: India needs reforms push to draw investments, says Economic Survey
items.summary: The Economic Survey recommends an empowered center and task force to attract top multinationals and boost FDI, positioning India as an alternative production hub. A multi-pronged strategy is needed to strengthen the investment climate by addressing structural and cyclical factors, promoting India's stability, growth, and market size.

items.title: Reforms may push growth rate to 7% in medium term: Economic Survey
items.summary: India's economic growth potential has increased to 7 percent. This rise is attributed to ongoing reforms that are strengthening the nation's productive capacity. Further improvements in manufacturing and exports could boost growth even higher. The economy is set for steady growth amidst global challenges. Reforms in investment, infrastructure, and business ease are driving this positive outlook.

items.title: Air India orders 30 more Boeing 737 Max planes
items.summary: In an exciting move to elevate air travel options, Air India is set to welcome 30 new Boeing 737 Max aircraft into its fleet. These modern jets will primarily serve Air India Express, the airline’s low-cost venture. The order comprises 20 units of the 737-8 and 10 units of the larger 737-10 model.

items.title: India-EU trade pact will help boost tourism, demand for hotels, says Louvre Hotels CEO
items.summary: India and the European Union's free trade agreement is set to boost travel and hospitality demand. Louvre Hotels Group sees India as its fastest-growing market. The company is investing in Sarovar Hotels, its Indian arm, to expand its presence. Sarovar aims for significant growth and plans to increase its hotel count through franchising and third-party management.

items.title: Indian aviation has seen big shift, UDAN to expand infra: PM
items.summary: During a series of high-stakes meetings, Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu engaged with representatives from the UAE, Saudi Arabia, Russia, and the Dominican Republic. The agenda revolved around enhancing aircraft manufacturing capabilities, promoting skill development, and addressing sustainability challenges within the aviation sector.

items.title: Amid carbon pricing jitters, India secures five key assurances from EU
items.summary: India has secured crucial advantages from the European Union regarding the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism.  These include MFN-like status, a technical dialogue for clarity, and potential for Indian verifiers.  Assurances on carbon pricing policy recognition and a flexible agreement framework are also in place.  These measures aim to facilitate Indian industry's access to the European market.

items.title: Nelco, Yotta application for starting satellite-based communication service rejected
items.summary: The Department of Telecommunications has denied Global Mobile Personal Communication by Satellite (GMPCS) authorization to Tata-owned Nelco and Yotta Network Services. This crucial license, required for satellite-based communication, has only been granted to Jio Satellite, Starlink, and OneWeb India. Applications from Nelco and Yotta were rejected after examination.

items.title: Opening up nuclear power will enhance strategic autonomy: PK Mishra
items.summary: India is opening its nuclear power sector to private companies. This historic reform aims to boost nuclear energy capacity by 2047. It will provide clean, carbon-free baseload power. These steps align energy transition with energy security and reduce imports. This enhances India's strategic autonomy. Coal will still play a role in the near term.

items.title: Apple Buys Israeli AI Startup That Interprets Facial Movements
items.summary: Apple Inc. has acquired Israel-based artificial intelligence startup Q.ai, which develops technology for reading facial movements and understanding silent communication.

items.title: Gold price crashes 6%, silver 8% as sudden selloff grips precious metals: What's behind the fall? Explained
items.summary: Both gold and silver retreated sharply from their all-time high levels as the US dollar strengthened and amid a decline in the US stock market.

items.title: Gold falls as investors take profits after record high
items.summary: GLOBAL-PRECIOUS:Gold falls as investors take profits after record high

items.title: Food weight to decline to 36.75% in new CPI series
items.summary: India's new Consumer Price Index series, effective February 12, will reduce food and beverage weight to 36.75% from 45.86%, reflecting evolving household spending. This shift aims to stabilize inflation readings and offer a more balanced monetary policy outlook. The revamped index also incorporates online market prices and rural housing rent for a comprehensive view.

items.title: DoT examining Amazon Kuiper satcom permit request, rejects Tata Group firm Nelco's application: MoS
items.summary: The Department of Telecom is reviewing Amazon Kuiper's satellite communication service applications.  Requests from Tata Group firm Nelco and Hiranandani Group company Yotta Network have been denied.  Other companies like OneWeb India, Jio Satellite, and Starlink have received unified licenses. Satellite services aim to connect remote and underserved areas across India.

items.title: US team meets Indian cos to boost hydrocarbon, nuclear-energy-related exports
items.summary: An American delegation met with Indian oil companies and industry leaders at India Energy Week to discuss increasing imports of US hydrocarbons and civil nuclear energy technologies. The US reaffirmed its commitment to a strong energy partnership, focusing on expanding reliable energy exports and supporting affordable, dependable energy supplies for India.

items.title: Vedanta moves HC over 2011 arbitral award declaring Balco shares transfer as void
items.summary: Vedanta Ltd is challenging a court decision regarding a 2011 arbitration award. The award declared a shareholders' agreement with the government void. This agreement concerned the transfer of shares in Bharat Aluminium Company, Balco. The government opposes Vedanta's appeal, citing significant financial stakes and a delay in filing. The case is set for a hearing on February 13.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights: Survey points to importance of inclusive development, with attention on farmers, MSMEs and youth employment, says PM Modi
items.summary: India’s potential growth rate revised to 6.8-7.2% range in FY27; Nirmala Sitharaman tabled survey in Parliament

items.title: Five baby Vedantas will step into stock exchanges in May, three to bear most debt load
items.summary: Vedanta is yet to finalize which resultant company will bear how much debt; however, each resultant company will get a share of Vedanta’s  ₹60,624-crore net debt based on the value of their assets and their cash generation abilities, the management said.

items.title: Economic Survey calls for fiscal flexibility for the Centre, cautions States against worsening finances
items.summary: The Economic Survey argued that, while the Centre has managed to substantially improve its fiscal deficit ratios since the COVID-19 pandemic, the States have seen their finances worsen over this period due to falling revenue and higher spending on unconditional cash transfers

items.title: Export momentum can be sustained with focus on higher value products, new destinations: Economic Survey
items.summary: An expanding network of Free Trade Agreements supports India’s trade strategy by offering reliable market access amid global uncertainty, according to the Economic Survey

items.title: EU banks can open 15 branches over four years under FTA with India
items.summary: India and the European Union have concluded a free trade agreement, set to be implemented this year. Under the pact, EU banks will be allowed to open 15 branches in India over four years. The agreement also includes provisions for 100% FDI in insurance and 74% in banking services, alongside safeguards for domestic industries and intellectual property rights.

items.title: Economic Survey: Critical minerals are ‘strategic choke-points’ in energy transition
items.summary: The CEA observed that as demand for such minerals spur, advanced economies promoting “standards-based critical markets” could carve challenges relating to affordability and entrapment in lower-value segments of the supply chain, among other things

items.title: Aequs reports 51% jump in revenue growth
items.summary: Karnataka-based Aequs reported a 51% revenue jump to Rs 326.2 crore in Q3FY26, driven by strong aerospace performance and consumer demand. Despite a rise in net loss due to investments and listing expenses, the company's EBITDA significantly increased. Aequs also announced its entry into UAV manufacturing and received PLI approval for electronics components.

items.title: Delhi, Bengaluru, Pune, Lucknow airports among others get awards at Wings India 2026
items.summary: Wings India 2026 awards celebrated aviation excellence. Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport won Best Aerodrome of the Year. Air India was recognized for domestic connectivity. Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport led in the over 25 million passengers category. Other airports and service providers also received accolades. The event highlights India's growing aviation sector.

items.title: Economic Survey calls for policies to promote flexible work to increase female workforce
items.summary: India's Economic Survey 2025-26 reveals women face workplace hurdles like limited mobility and rigid schedules.  It calls for flexible work, equal pay, and safety measures to boost female employment.  Women spend more time on unpaid caregiving, impacting their paid work participation.  Recent years show a rise in women joining the workforce and a drop in unemployment.

items.title: Paytm Q3 PAT raises to ₹225 crore
Manufacturing sector needs mission-based approach
Eco Survey: Indian auto industry witnessing tremendous growth in exports
items.summary: The industry has recorded nearly 33% growth in production over the last decade (from FY15 to FY25)

items.title: Mumbai sees housing surge as mid-segment options expand; buy now or wait? New hotspots emerge
items.summary: Mumbai’s housing market is shifting as luxury launches slow and mid-segment homes dominate new supply, even as prices continue to rise. With demand strong in emerging suburbs, buyers planning for 2026 face a choice between waiting or locking in homes in fast-growing locations.

items.title: Fodder shortage major hurdle for livestock sector: Economic Survey
items.summary: Feed and fodder shortages, which account for a significant share of milk production costs, are the most critical constraint, as livestock growth has outpaced fodder expansion

items.title: Economic Survey expects inflation to be benign in FY27
items.summary: The moderation in retail inflation can primarily be attributed to the general disinflationary trend in food and fuel prices, which together account for 52.7 per cent of India’s Consumer Price Index (CPI) basket, the Survey said

items.title: Export diversification blunts blow of US tariffs, says Economic Survey
items.summary: Labour-intensive sectors turn to Europe, West Asia and Asia as US share shrinks

items.title: Mastercard profit exceeds expectations, set to lay off 4% globally; shares nudge up
items.summary: Mastercard exceeded fourth-quarter profit expectations due to resilient consumer spending, particularly in travel and essentials. The company announced plans to lay off approximately 4% of its global workforce, impacting over 1,400 employees, to reallocate investments. This strategic restructuring is expected to incur a $200 million charge in the current quarter.

items.title: Bulk deal: Goldman Sachs trims Manappuram Finance stake; CLSA offloads Sunteck Realty shares
items.summary: Goldman Sachs offloaded over 65.27 lakh shares in Manappuram Finance for approximately Rs 190 crore, with Morgan Stanley as the buyer. In a separate transaction, CLSA sold 71.61 lakh shares of Sunteck Realty for Rs 269 crore, with Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley acquiring them.

items.title: Economy Survey proposes QCO framework aligned to industry readiness
items.summary: Overly narrow transition periods can unintentionally burden MSMEs that the QCOs are meant to support

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 paints rosy picture of job scenario, raises concerns on inequality among gig workers
items.summary: 40% of gig workers report earnings below ₹15,000 per month; they have ‘thin-file’ credit access, which remains a concern as well

items.title: Gold price plunges 4% after rallying to record highs; silver drops 6%
items.summary: The price of gold tumbled more than five percent Thursday as traders reassessed the market after recent record highs for the precious metal seen as a safe-haven investment.  Silver plunged more than eight percent, while copper and nickel prices also fell.

items.title: Friedman’s pencil lesson guides Economic Survey’s caution on India’s QCO push
items.summary: Drawing on US economist Milton Friedman’s observation on pencil, the survey said that regulations introduced without comprehensive value-chain assessment risk creating cascading effects&nbsp;

items.title: Nasdaq profit beats estimates; CEO touts IPO pipeline
items.summary: Nasdaq reported strong fourth-quarter profits, exceeding expectations due to market volatility. The company saw a significant rise in new listings, with a promising outlook for accelerated initial public offerings in 2026. Nasdaq's revenue from data and listing services increased, and its financial technology and index businesses also showed robust growth. The exchange operator is expanding its services beyond trading.

items.title: Economic Survey flags ‘digital addiction’ crisis: Warns of mental health toll on India’s youth
items.summary: Suggests that social media platforms should be made responsible for age verification

items.title: Coforge sweetens India’s largest IT deal after shareholder pushback
items.summary: Despite support from global giants like Norges Bank, domestic institutions blocked the move, forcing Coforge to remove Advent’s influence over audit and remuneration committees to ensure the Encora acquisition proceeds.

items.title: Airbus eyes $2 billion annual sourcing from India
items.summary: Airbus said India’s commerical aircraft fleet will triple in size to 2,250 aircraft over the next decade

items.title: Bitcoin prices today: Crypto token drops over 5% to $84,400, market capitalisation hits $1.68 trillion
items.summary: Bitcoin, the largest cryptocurrency, hit a new low of $84,410 on January 29, marking a 5.43% drop amid a market sell-off. Its market capitalisation is $1.68 trillion, with a trading volume of $50.59 billion in the past 24 hours.

items.title: Nearly 2,900 km of Namo Bharat RRTS corridors identified across India: Economic Survey
items.summary: India is set to expand its Namo Bharat Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) with nearly 2,900 km of potential corridors identified to boost economic growth. The Delhi-Meerut line has already shown significant employment and accessibility gains. The initiative also prioritizes women's employment and integrates Transit-Oriented Development for sustainable urban growth, reducing emissions.

items.title: Experts group recommends lowering food & beverage weight in new CPI
items.summary: The expert group recommended lowering the weight of food and beverage to 36.75 from 45.86

items.title: Cutting carbon emissions should not be top priority: Economic Survey
items.summary: The Survey in its past iterations has framed climate change as a global risk that threatens food production, livelihoods and has called upon countries - at various times - to “support” developing countries such as India to transition away from fossil fuel

items.title: Economic Survey calls for ‘rationalising’ tax on debt instruments
items.summary: The Survey noted that the corporate bond markets were shallow and illiquid, securitisation was limited, municipal bonds were underdeveloped, and pension and insurance funds remain conservative investors due to regulatory and cultural inertia

items.title: Economic Survey delivers powerful message of India's growth, say experts
items.summary: India's Economic Survey 2025-26 projects robust growth of 6.8-7.2% amid global fragmentation, highlighting medium-term priorities like manufacturing and skill development. Experts view this as a strategic advantage, with potential GDP growth revised to 7% driven by capital expenditure and reforms. The survey emphasizes attracting global capital through faster execution and regulatory certainty.

items.title: Niva Bupa Health Insurance posts Q3 net loss of ₹87.64 crore, gross premium rises 55%
items.summary: Niva Bupa Health Insurance reports Q3 net loss of Rs 87.64 crore, despite a 55% rise in gross premium

items.title: Cupid net triples in Q3, to issue 4:1 bonus shares
items.summary: Income more than doubled to ₹104 crore (₹51 crore) in the quarter under review. EBITDA was more than doubled to ₹34 crore

items.title: Air India orders 30 Boeing 737 Max aircraft, opts for 15 long range Airbus planes
items.summary: A321XLR deliveries expected in 2029-30

items.title: Here’s everything you need to know about the Economic Survey 2026
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 was tabled in the Parliament today by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. The Survey, prepared by the Economic Division of the Department of Economic Affairs under the Ministry of Finance, and credited to the Chief Economic Advisor - currently Dr V Anantha Nageswaran - offers a detailed view of how India’s economy fared in the past year, and will be closely watched by economists, policymakers and the public.

items.title: India to build end-to-end critical mineral value chains: Economic Survey
items.summary: Focus on exploration, mining, processing and recycling to strengthen supply security

items.title: India now has 958 million active internet users; 57% of these are from rural areas
items.summary: Rural regions now account for over 57% of India’s active internet users and are growing at nearly four times the pace of urban India, signalling a structural shift in where and how digital adoption is expanding

items.title: Gold near Rs 1.8 lakh, silver above Rs 4 lakh—What’s fueling the record rally?
items.summary: Safe-haven buying has increased due to ongoing geopolitical tensions and economic uncertainty. Adding to this, the U.S. The Federal Reserve has voted not to increase interests saying it is very unlikely that rates will increase anytime soon. These signals have supported precious metal prices worldwide.

items.title: Economic Survey calls for tackling rising digital addiction and screen-related mental health problems
items.summary: The Survey proposes expanding the national Tele-MANAS programme beyond crisis counselling to actively address digital addiction

items.title: India-EU FTA FAQs: From overall benefits for New Delhi, Brussels to key mobility related gains, here's all
items.summary: India and the European Union have finalized a free trade agreement after nearly two decades of negotiations, creating a vast market and eliminating EU tariffs on 90% of Indian goods. items.title: Paytm Q3 Results: Profit skyrockets 971% QoQ to Rs 225 crore
items.summary: Paytm Q3 Results: Financial services technology platform Paytm on Thursday reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 225 crore in the third quarter. This compares with a loss of Rs 208 crore in the year-ago period. On a sequential basis, profit jumped 971% from Rs 21 crore posted in the preceding September quarter.

items.title: Airport expansion gathers pace as air traffic rises: Economic Survey
items.summary: Passenger traffic projected to grow from 412 million in FY25 to 665 million by FY31; greenfield airports and modernisation drive adding capacity

items.title: Growth, Gold, Swadeshi & Global risks: 10 signals from the Economic Survey 2026
From Rs 3 Lakh to 4 Lakh in 10 Days: Silver rally signals rising global risks, says Economic Survey
items.summary: The white metal’s fastest-ever Rs 1-lakh surge in six weeks mirrors investor caution amid rising geopolitical and financial uncertainty, says the Economic Survey 2025–26.

items.title: Economic Survey: UPI is expanding lending across the risk spectrum
items.summary: Fintech firms especially play a distinctive role in reaching borrowers who were previously excluded from formal finance, the Economic Survey said.

items.title: VB-G RAM G enacted in backdrop of notable decline in work demand under MGNREGS: Economic Survey
items.summary: India has replaced the MGNREGA with the Viksit Bharat-Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission Act 2025. This new law guarantees 125 days of wage employment annually. The move follows a significant decline in MGNREGS work demand and a strengthening of rural economic conditions. The Act aims to enhance accountability and infrastructure outcomes.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Key takeaways in charts
items.summary: Here is a look at the key figures from the Economic Survey 2025-26.

items.title: Punjab & Sind Bank gets RBI nod to open branch in GIFT City
items.summary: Punjab & Sind Bank will open a branch at GIFT City in Gandhinagar, Gujarat. The Reserve Bank of India has given its approval. This move marks the bank's entry into international banking. The GIFT City IFSC is India's premier international financial hub. The bank aims to strengthen its foreign currency lending and trade finance capabilities.

items.title: Dow layoffs: Chemicals maker to slash 4,500 jobs amid sluggish demand — here's what we know
items.summary: Dow plans to cut 4,500 jobs, about 13% of its workforce, to enhance profitability by $2 billion, while projecting lower first-quarter revenue. Shares fell 3% as global chemical firms reassess strategies amid weak demand and rising costs.

items.title: Fiscal indiscipline of states to have an impact on sovereign borrowing costs: CEA Anantha Nageswaran
items.summary: States' spending on populist doles is raising concerns. The Economic Survey warns this fiscal indiscipline will increase borrowing costs for the nation. While the Centre has managed its finances, rising state deficits and cash transfers pose risks. This impacts investor confidence in general government finances. The long-term economic costs of such transfers may also be significant.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Urban land dead capital, must be used well
items.summary: The Survey highlights that land-use restrictions and ambiguity about land titles may be causing urban land to become “dead capital”

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 projects 6.8–7.2% GDP growth; industry leaders welcome outlook
items.summary: Economic Survey 2025-26: Industry leaders and economic experts on Thursday welcomed the Economic Survey 2025-26, describing it as a pragmatic assessment of India's macroeconomic stability.

items.title: Stray Dogs Case: 3-judge SC bench reserves decision on issue of strays across country
items.summary: The verdict on the relocation of the stray dogs to shelters in Delhi-NCR sparked an uproar from several quarters of society and was later modified by the three-judge Bench.

items.title: How India’s informal watchdogs are forcing consumer brands to clean up their act
items.summary: They have no connection with each other, but together, a motley band of independent watchdogs, influencers, online communities, and third-party platforms has kindled a consumer awakening across India.

items.title: India to cut food weighting in CPI in new inflation series
items.summary: India is set to revise its inflation measurement, significantly reducing food's weight in the Consumer Price Index to 36.75%. This shift aims to stabilize inflation readings, impacting monetary policy. The updated basket will reflect current spending, incorporating rural rents and e-commerce prices for a more accurate economic picture.

items.title: ITC Q3 results: Net profit remains flat at  ₹5,018 crore; revenue up 6.7%, announces interim dividend  ₹6.5 per share
items.summary: ITC Ltd reported a Q3 FY26 net profit of  ₹5,018 crore, slightly up from last year. Revenue rose 6.7% YoY to  ₹21,706 crore, with strong FMCG growth and digital-first portfolios driving performance despite a decline in profit sequentially.

items.title: Five Budget cues to look out for
items.summary: With both income-tax and GST cuts done, investors need to look for five indirect cues that will impact them

items.title: Swadeshi must build exports, not walls: Economic Survey
items.summary: Import substitution alone insufficient in a world of volatile capital and supply chains

items.title: Montra Electric delivers India’s first ‘PM E-DRIVE’ certified electric truck
items.summary: Montra Electric has delivered the electric heavy truck, Rhino 5538 EV 6x4 Tractor trailer, to UltraTech Cement

items.title: Current pilot-aircraft ratio 'adequate' at domestic airlines: Government
items.summary: The civil aviation ministry has deemed the current pilot-aircraft ratio at domestic airlines "adequate," despite recent IndiGo disruptions linked to flight duty norm compliance. The DGCA mandates three crew sets per aircraft, with airlines conducting periodic reviews to ensure operational stability and pilot well-being. IndiGo has assured sufficient crew by February 2026.

items.title: ITC Q3 Results: Cons PAT flat at Rs 4,931 crore, revenue up 7%; Rs 6.50 per share dividend announced
items.summary: ITC Q3 Results: FMCG major ITC's December quarter consolidated net profit stood at Rs 4,931 crore, flat compared to Rs 4,935 crore reported in the year ago period.

items.title: Investment of Rs 13,700 crore takes up mobile phone production of Rs 9.34 lakh crore: Economic Survey
items.summary: India's electronics sector is booming. A mobile manufacturing incentive scheme has spurred massive production and exports. Electronics production grew significantly in FY'25, with exports also rising sharply. The sector is on track to become a top export category. Mobile manufacturing has seen a huge jump. India is also focusing on semiconductors to build domestic capacity and reduce import reliance.

items.title: Dabur Q3 Results: Cons PAT grows 7% YoY to Rs 560 crore, revenue up 6%
items.summary: Dabur India posted a 7% rise in Q3 profit and 6% revenue growth, led by FMCG expansion, strong India market share gains and double-digit international growth. Sequential profits jumped sharply, underscoring resilient demand, brand strength and broad-based category performance.

items.title: CEA warns of fragile global outlook in 2026, sees rising risk of disorder
items.summary: CEA suggests that adverse outcomes can no longer be treated as tail risks

items.title: Quess Corp Q3 Results: PAT rises 32% to Rs 55 crore
items.summary: Staffing and workforce solutions provider Quess Corp reported a 32 per cent year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 55.09 crore for the quarter ended December 31, 2025.

items.title: KPIT Tech Q3 Results: Net profit plunges 29% to Rs 133 crore; revenue up 9% to Rs 1,617 crore
items.summary: Mobility and automotive solutions company KPIT Technologies on Thursday reported a 28.7 per cent decline in consolidated net profit to Rs 133.30 crore for the December quarter, primarily weighed down by a one-time statutory impact related to new labour codes.

items.title: Cupid Q3 results: Net profits surge 196% YoY to  ₹33 crore; 4:1 bonus issue announced — Details here
items.summary: Cupid Q3 results: Cupid's net profits recorded a 196% YoY rise in its consolidated net profits to  ₹33 crore in the October to December quarter of FY2025-26. The company also announced a bonus issue for its shareholders at a 4:1 ratio. Here's what you need to know.

items.title: ATR, Fly91 ink maintenance agreement
items.summary: Fly91, a pure play regional airline, currently operates four ATR 72‑600s, with two more scheduled to arrive arriving in early 2026

items.title: Economic Survey calls for strengthening India's long-term debt market
items.summary: India’s Economic Survey has underlined the urgent need to strengthen long-term capital markets to support infrastructure development and climate-related investments. The report flags shallow corporate bond markets, underdeveloped municipal bonds, and the risk-averse nature of institutional investors as key challenges. It recommends measures such as rationalising tax treatment for debt instruments and strengthening credit enhancement mechanisms to deepen market participation and improve maturity profiles.

items.title: Honest officials must be protected from vexatious prosecution: Economic Survey
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 advocates for protecting honest officials from vexatious prosecution to foster an entrepreneurial state in India. It calls for legal frameworks to safeguard good-faith decision-making, distinguishing errors from corruption, and re-orienting agencies like the CAG to prioritize learning over blame.

items.title: Voltas Q3 Results: Profit slumps 35% to Rs 84 crore, revenue dips marginally
items.summary: Leading air-conditioning maker and engineering services provider Voltas Ltd on Thursday reported a 35.4 per cent decline in its consolidated net profit to Rs 84.46 crore for the December quarter of FY26.

items.title: Economic Survey reflects healthy fundamentals, robust reforms across sectors: FM Sitharaman
items.summary: FM Nirmala Sitharaman said the Economic Survey 2025-26 reflects the healthy banking fundamentals, achieved due to the various banking reforms undertaken by Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government in the last decade.

items.title: SHANTI Act enables private sector participation in equipment manufacturing, R&D
items.summary: The SHANTI Act updates India’s nuclear legal framework, including the Atomic Energy Act of 1962 and the Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act of 2010, to permit private sector and state government participation previously banned by the 1962 Act, as per the Economic Survey for FY26

items.title: Economic Survey calls for activity-based regulation to curb arbitrage and boost financial stability
items.summary: The Economic Survey advocates for a shift from entity-based to activity-based regulations, focusing on transaction risk and function to prevent regulatory arbitrage. This approach aims to foster a diversified financial ecosystem where banks, NBFCs, fintechs, and market lenders compete on a level playing field, ensuring systemic stability and promoting innovation.

items.title: Blue Star Q3 profit plunges 39% on Labour Code impact
items.summary: The air conditioning and refrigeration company’s consolidated revenue grew modestly by 4.2 per cent to ₹2,925.31 crore

items.title: VCA Group’s steady rise in Shivaji Park is built on discipline, quality and trust
items.summary: In Mumbai's evolving real estate market, VCA Group prioritizes discipline and consistent execution over speed.  Their focus on regulatory clarity, construction excellence, and long-term vision, particularly evident in Shivaji Park, has solidified their reputation.  Active leadership ensures quality and timely delivery, building trust through proven reliability.

items.title: Small businesses still turn to friends, moneylenders for loans, says Economic Survey
items.summary: Micro and unincorporated enterprises still rely heavily informal sources like friends and moneylenders for small-ticket loans, even as formal sources of credit have improved for large loans.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025: will NSIL pick up the slack of a flat space budget?
items.summary: The gap between what the industry wants and what the Department of Space needs has never been wider

items.title: SMFG India Credit partners with Google for collateral-free loans via GPay
items.summary: Through this collaboration, loans will be disbursed in minutes to eligible Google Pay users who apply for a loan through the app

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Hindustan Copper, Vedanta among 6 stocks in focus on Thursday
items.summary: Indian markets rose for a third day, led by financials and energy. Hindustan Copper hit a record, L&T and Vedanta gained, eClerx jumped on results, while BEL slipped on brokerage views and Five-Star fell after earnings pressure elsewhere persisted modestly.

items.title: Financial sector regulators must walk the tightrope to balance growth with stability: Economic Survey
items.summary: Significant improvement has been observed in the asset quality of scheduled commercial banks (SCBs), as evidenced by their Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) ratio standing at 2.2% and net NPA ratio at 0.5% in September 2025, having reached a multi-decadal low level and record low level, respectively.

items.title: Reliance Industries to buy up to 150,000 bpd of Russian oil from February
items.summary: Reliance Industries will purchase up to 150,000 barrels per day of Russian oil starting in February for its domestic market refinery. This follows a pause and a U.S. concession that allowed winding down dealings with sanctioned producer Rosneft. Reliance will source from non-sanctioned sellers as it diversifies supply.

items.title: With rise in production, India looks at expansion of seaweed cultivation
items.summary: India is poised for a major expansion in seaweed cultivation and seaweed-based industries, with the sector identified as a key driver of sustainable livelihoods and coastal development

items.title: Economic Survey calls for 20-year city plans for all million-plus cities
items.summary: India's Economic Survey for 2025-26 proposes mandatory 20-year city plans for urban centers. These plans will focus on transport, housing, and land value capture. The survey highlights cities as economic engines and calls for integrated planning. It notes progress in urban infrastructure and housing schemes. Future policy will prioritize dynamic, inclusive, and sustainable cities.

items.title: Swadeshi inevitable as Economic Survey 2026 calls for disciplined self-reliance
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2026 says Swadeshi is inevitable as global export controls, technology curbs and trade barriers end the era of naive globalisation. It calls for disciplined self-reliance to reduce external vulnerabilities while strengthening competitiveness and long-term economic resilience.

items.title: Piramal Pharma Q3 Results: Co reports loss as CDMO slowdown drags revenue
items.summary: Piramal Pharma swung to a Rs 136 crore Q3 loss as revenue fell 3%, hit by CDMO destocking, weak US biopharma funding, trade uncertainty and regulatory delays. Management sees recovery signs, cost controls cushioning EBITDA, and expects a stronger Q4.

items.title: Rs 180 Dividend Stock: BSE 500 firm declares cash reward for shareholders - Check record date
items.summary: Gillette India announced an interim dividend of Rs 180 per equity share, which includes a one-time special dividend of Rs 60 per share for the financial year 2025-26.

items.title: Chemical stock jumps over 4% from today's low following stock market rebound. Do you own?
items.summary: Sudarshan Pharma shares surged nearly 4% to  ₹20.25 after reporting Q3FY26 revenue of  ₹158.37 crore, a 37% YoY increase. Net profit rose 56% to  ₹43.05 crore. Despite a 27.40% drop in January, the stock shows a strong long-term gain of 165%.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Rail track commissioning more than doubles since 2014
items.summary: The Indian Railways is undergoing a remarkable transformation, with the pace of new track commissioning soaring since 2014. High capital investments are funneled into expanding the network and refurbishing older lines. The introduction of dedicated freight corridors is significantly alleviating congestion, allowing for quicker transit times. Meanwhile, expansive station redevelopment projects are reshaping travel hubs nationwide.

items.title: Motorola introduces Moto G77, G67 with 108MP camera, AMOLED display and military-grade durability
items.summary: Motorola Moto G77 & G67 Introduced: Lenovo company-owned Motorola has introduced two new models in the Moto G family – the Moto G77 and Moto G67 – in the global market. These mid‑tier smartphones, according to the company, come with vivid displays, intelligent camera systems, and military-grade durability. Check details:

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Big announcements, no major tax relief? Here's what brokerages say
items.summary: Union Budget 2026 is expected to stay focused on fiscal discipline and growth led spending, with brokerages signalling that broad based tax relief for the middle class is unlikely. Defence, capital expenditure and targeted policy announcements are seen as the key drivers for markets and the economy.

items.title: After Europe pacts, India eyes Chile, Canada for next trade deals: Report
items.summary: India has rapidly secured three free trade pacts across Europe. Talks are progressing with Chile and Canada. Agreements with Asean nations are improving. Discussions are also ongoing with Israel and the Gulf Cooperation Council. India is also exploring trade with the Mercosur bloc.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 bats for 26% government shareholding in PSUs
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 suggests a radical shift in how state-run companies are defined and divested.

items.title: India should think less on tariffs, more on opportunities to boost trade: World Bank's Ajay Banga
items.summary: World Bank President Ajay Banga urged India to prioritize trade opportunities over tariffs. He highlighted India's extensive trade pacts, including the recent India-EU free trade agreement. Banga noted the significant growth of emerging markets in global trade over the past two decades. This new deal will boost trade between India and the European Union.

items.title: For every international student coming to India, 28 Indian students went abroad
items.summary: India needs to ramp up its ‘education-tourism’ strategy to attract more international students, as competition from neighbouring countries has increased.

items.title: Passenger fare hikes reduce Railways' dependence on freight: Economic Survey
items.summary: Indian Railways' freight earnings share is decreasing due to passenger fare adjustments. This trend is expected to continue. High freight rates impact competition and prices. Rationalising these rates could boost revenue and encourage rail transport. Freight loading shows strong momentum, supported by core sectors.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc OFS sees strong retail subscription of 2.3 times on Day 2
items.summary: Hindustan Zinc’s OFS drew strong interest, with the retail portion subscribed 2.3 times on Day 2 as investors bid for 1.10 crore shares against 47.58 lakh on offer. This followed a robust 142% non-retail subscription on Day 1, underscoring solid demand at the Rs 685 floor price despite the stock trading higher.

items.title: Budget 2026 and Real Estate: Time for long-term fixes, not short-term band-aids
items.summary: With the Union Budget 2026-27 on the horizon, the real estate landscape is buzzing with expectations for transformative reforms. Primary concerns revolve around making housing more accessible, ensuring taxation is straightforward, and speeding up project sanctioning processes. There’s a strong demand from buyers for increased deductions on housing loan interest.

items.title: Economic Survey calls for long investment horizons in innovation, skills in private sector to support national goals
items.summary: Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran, Economic Survey 2026 calls the private sector to “marry commercial dynamism with conscious contribution to nation-building”, noting that they must recognize role in shaping social trust and institutional credibility.

items.title: Indian renewables firms urge pause on auctions as backlogs surge
items.summary: Renewable energy firms in India are asking the government to halt new project auctions. They want existing projects to find buyers first. Firms warn of more power output cuts if grid issues continue. Over 42 gigawatts of capacity are awaiting power supply contracts. Grids in Gujarat and Rajasthan are rejecting green power. This practice is known as curtailment.

items.title: Rosatom showcases nuclear technologies at Indian Energy Week
items.summary: Rosatom showcased its comprehensive nuclear energy solutions, including floating power units and SMRs, while inviting India to join a consortium for the powerful MBIR research reactor.  This collaboration aims to deepen ties in nuclear projects, medicine, and digital solutions, building on decades of partnership and the success of the Kudankulam plant.

items.title: How Economic Survey projections stack up against actual GDP growth
items.summary: The Economic Survey gives forecasts of how the economy is projected to grow in the next year. The estimates are often cautious and are given in the form of a range.

items.title: Economic Survey pegs global climate finance gap at $4 tn, says bond markets crucial to bridge it
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights a $4 trillion financing gap for climate and sustainable development, particularly affecting developing economies. It emphasizes the need for better funding in critical areas like climate adaptation and urban infrastructure.

items.title: Boeing unfazed by India-EU FTA, says maintenance cost unlikely to decline soon
items.summary: Despite the India-EU FTA eliminating tariffs on aircraft parts, Boeing remains skeptical about significant cost reductions for maintenance in India. Airbus might see marginal advantages, but the focus remains on increasing aircraft deliveries to meet growing demand in the Indian market.

items.title: India's commercial aircraft fleet to triple by 2035: Airbus
items.summary: Addressing a press conference on the sidelines of Wings India 2026 in Hyderabad, Jurgen Westermeier, President and Managing Director, Airbus India and South Asia, said, "We are witnessing the centre of global aviation shift toward the east. India's fleet expansion will not only enhance domestic mobility but will position the country as a dominant hub for international transit. Therefore, the next chapter of Indian aviation must ensure its operating models evolve at the same pace as the expansion in its fleet and network."

items.title: Economic Survey highlights telecom PLI's big success
items.summary: Economic Survey 2025-26: Telecommunications is positioned as a “foundational backbone of the digital economy,” contributing directly about 1.2% to Gross Value Added (GVA), the survey said.

items.title: IEX Q3 Results: Cons net profit jumps 11% YoY to Rs 119 crore; co declares interim dividend
items.summary: Indian Energy Exchange posted an 11% YoY rise in consolidated Q3 profit to Rs 119 crore, driven by stronger revenue and higher trading volumes. The company declared a Rs 1.50 interim dividend. Revenue grew 14% YoY to Rs 183 crore, while power prices softened and IGX reported steady growth in gas-trading volumes.

items.title: RBI defers plan to mandate climate risk disclosures by banks, sources say
items.summary:
RBI's decision to hold off on issuing final ‌climate disclosure norms for Indian banks has not been previously
reported

items.title: Gold and silver soar as U.S. trust frays, warns Aswath Damodaran
items.summary: Aswath Damodaran argues 2025 market moves reflect a deep trust deficit in US institutions. Bonds stayed calm, the dollar weakened, gold and silver surged, while bitcoin failed to act as a haven, trading like a risky equity throughout the year.

items.summary: Swara Baby Products Private Limited has established a new hygiene vertical. The consolidated group aims for consistent research, development, and quality assurance. This integration seeks to offer clients a comprehensive range of disposable hygiene products.

items.title: World faces copper shortage as AI data centres drive power demand: Economic Survey
items.summary: Copper price has become increasingly volatile due to mine outages in Indonesia, Congo and Chile, raising concerns about supply deficits in the medium to long term, the Survey said.

items.title: Double-decker metro takes shape as Delhi readies first viaduct for train runs
items.summary: Delhi's first double-decker metro viaduct is now ready for trains. This marks a significant step in the city's metro expansion. The viaduct will carry metro trains above and vehicles below. Other double-decker structures are also under construction. This expansion will enhance connectivity across the city.

items.title: India exports 5.3 million vehicles in FY25 as global demand for made-in-India autos grows: Survey
items.summary: India's car exports reached 5.3 million vehicles last fiscal year. Vehicle exports are growing strongly. Production has risen significantly over the past decade. The automotive sector supports over 30 million jobs and contributes to GST collections. Government policies are boosting electric mobility. This strengthens the sector's growth outlook.

items.title: Economic Survey: Labour reforms could add 1.25% to GDP by FY30
items.summary: Survey flags gains from higher formalisation, productivity and worker welfare

items.title: Economic Survey proposes opening heritage monuments, ease forex payments to boost concert market
items.summary: India's concert economy can grow significantly. The Economic Survey highlights a need for more live event venues and easier foreign payments for artists. Opening heritage monuments for concerts and streamlining visa and foreign exchange permissions are suggested. This can boost media, entertainment, and tourism sectors. International examples show strong economic gains from live music.

items.title: Broker’s call: TVS Motor (Add)
items.summary: ICICI Securities

items.title: Travel, insurance take over 60% of discretionary spend, shows CMS report
items.summary: Travel and insurance are becoming top priorities for Indian consumers, signaling a new era in discretionary spending. Essentials and lifestyle enhancements are now taking a backseat. Interestingly, cash transactions remain robust, particularly in semi-urban and rural regions, highlighting a preference for tangible spending.

items.title: Bottom 10% see sharpest rise in consumption, fall in poverty: Economic Survey
items.summary: The Survey highlighted positive outcomes from subsidies, pensions, direct benefit transfers and public spending on education and healthcare, which have lifted the vulnerable out of deprivation

items.title: Rupee hits record low, RBI intervention averts fall past 92
items.summary: The Indian rupee hit ‍a record low against the dollar ​on Thursday, pressured by dollar demand linked to the maturity ⁠of non-deliverable forward positions and corporate hedging, while the central bank likely intervened to hold it above the psychologically significant 92 level.

items.title: Economic Survey calls for multi-pronged push to sustain FDI amid global volatility
items.summary: The Economic Survey flagged the need for targeted outreach, reliable incentives and institutional fixes to lift foreign investment

items.title: Broker’s call: Piramal Pharma (Reduce)
items.summary: Choice International

items.title: Mahindra Holidays Q3 profit plummets on one-time charge, slow membership growth
items.summary: Mahindra Holidays and Resorts India reported a ‍94% plunge in third-quarter ​profit on Thursday, dragged by a one-time ⁠charge following the roll-out of India's new labour codes and slower membership growth.

items.title: REC Q3 Results: Net profit flat at  ₹4,043 crore;  ₹4.6 interim dividend declared
items.summary: REC reported a standalone net profit of  ₹4,043.08 crore for Q3 FY26, a slight increase from  ₹4,029.09 crore in the previous year. The company declared a 46% interim dividend of  ₹4.60 per equity share, with the record date set for February 6, 2026.

items.title: India's textile exporters pin hopes on EU deal after US tariff blow
items.summary: Indian textile and apparel exporters are looking to a new trade agreement with the European Union to counter losses from high US tariffs. The EU pact, effective in about a year, will remove duties on most Indian goods, including textiles. This offers a crucial opening for market access as US shipments have significantly dropped.

items.title: Deepak Fertilisers Q3 profit falls on softer chemical demand, high costs
items.summary: India's Deepak Fertilisers and Petrochemicals reported a ‍43.6% fall in ​third-quarter profit on Thursday, as softer agrochemicals ⁠demand and rising input costs squeezed margins.

items.title: NMDC exploring coal reserves in Canada to boost steel capacity
items.summary: India's state-run miner NMDC is actively exploring coal reserves in Canada. This move aims to significantly boost India's steel manufacturing capacity. The exploration follows a meeting between Indian and Canadian ministers to deepen cooperation in critical minerals and sustainable development. India seeks stable supplies of raw materials like coking coal to support its expanding steel production and clean energy transition.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights India’s power gap
items.summary: Despite regaining major power status and overtaking China in investment inflows, India's influence in Asia remains below its potential.

items.title: Russia boosts India's aircraft manufacturing industry
items.summary: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited is joining forces with Russia's United Aircraft Corporation. They will manufacture Sukhoi SJ-100 superjets in India. This move aims to boost regional air travel. India needs over 200 jets in the coming decade. The SJ-100 will enhance short-haul connectivity. HAL will also get rights for local certification and sales. UAC will provide technical support for HAL's facilities.

items.title: Kerala Tourism and The Hindu Group to host ‘Kerala for All’ conclave on inclusive and accessible tourism
items.summary: A two-day knowledge conclave on inclusive and accessible tourism will be held on January 31 and February 1 in Kochi; the conclave will be inaugurated by Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan

items.title: Vedanta Q3 Results: Anil Agarwal-led firm's profit jumps 61% YoY to  ₹5,710 crore, revenue hits  ₹45,899 crore
items.summary: Vedanta Q3 results: Vedanta Ltd, led by Anil Agarwal, reported a 61% increase in Q3 profit attributable to owners to  ₹5,710 crore, up from  ₹3,547 crore last year.

items.title: Economic Survey flags income volatility, credit gaps for India’s gig workers
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025–26 reveals that while India’s gig workforce has grown, structural issues such as income volatility and a lack of formal credit remain widespread.

items.title: Vedanta Q3 Results: Profit surges 61% YoY to Rs 5,710 crore
items.summary: Vedanta reported a significant 61% year-on-year profit jump to Rs 5,710 crore in the third quarter. The company achieved its highest-ever quarterly EBITDA of Rs 15,171 crore, with a strong operational performance across most businesses, particularly in aluminium production.

items.title: KINFRA signs MoU with Telengana-based Goldsikka for Global Gold City at Mattannur
items.summary: The project likely to create one lakh direct jobs in three years

items.title: Germany’s Nemetschek group to expand global capability centre in India
items.summary: Nemetschek Group is significantly expanding its India operations. The company plans to double its workforce by next year. India will become a key hub for product development and innovation. Solutions built in India will be deployed globally. This expansion focuses on creating centres of excellence for advanced technologies and customer support.

items.title: No FDs please: Indian households' financial savings strategy changes
items.summary: Indian households are increasingly investing in equities and market-linked instruments. This shift marks a significant change from traditional bank deposits. The trend shows growing confidence in riskier assets. While equity participation is rising, the debt market remains underdeveloped. Developing the debt market is the next step for a robust financial system.

items.title: Economic Survey warns growth-driven microfinance may undermine household welfare
items.summary: The Economic Survey called for more consistent alignment between impact objectives and investor incentives by linking exit decisions and valuations to the achievement of social purpose metrics, rather than exclusively to financial performance.

items.title: India set to become world’s third largest aviation market, Airbus outlines its industrial footprint
Swiggy Q3 Results: Net loss widens to  ₹1,065 crore, revenue surges 54%
items.summary: Swiggy reported a net loss of  ₹1,065 crore for Q4, an increase from  ₹800 crore last year, despite a 54% revenue rise to  ₹6,148 crore. Quick-commerce drove growth, with GOV surging 103.2% YoY. Monthly transacting users rose 0.8 million during the period.

items.title: Need to retain students beyond Class 8: Economic Survey
items.summary: India needs to keep students in school longer. The Economic Survey 2025-26 shows low enrollment after Class 8. Rural areas lack secondary schools, causing dropouts. Urban areas see higher enrollment. The survey suggests expanding schools and improving teacher training. Digital platforms can help provide quality education everywhere.

items.title: Mahindra Holidays reports 10% revenue growth, launches new Keystone membership
items.summary: The leisure hospitality provider added three new managed resorts during the quarter

items.title: Nokia chair Sari Baldauf to step down, Vice chair Timo Ihamuotil to succeed. Details here
items.summary: Nokia's chair Sari Baldauf is resigning, to be replaced by Timo Ihamuotila. The company is pushing into AI to counteract declining earnings, while shares dropped 6%. Baldauf has been a key figure at Nokia since the early 1980s.

items.title: Swiggy Q3 Results: Cons loss widens YoY to Rs 1,065 crore, but revenue jumps 54%
items.summary: Food delivery giant Swiggy's consolidated net loss widened to Rs 1,065 crore in Q3FY26, an increase from the previous year's Rs 799 crore. Despite the higher loss, the company saw significant revenue growth, with operations generating Rs 6,148 crore, a 54% year-on-year increase.

items.title: Economic Survey seeks faster insolvency resolution timelines, flags low MSME case uptake
items.summary: The survey calls for enhancing the insolvency framework to speed up recovery timelines and acknowledges improvements in credit discipline and reduced bad loans. However, the pre-packaged insolvency process for MSMEs has seen low adoption due to complex procedures and lack of awareness.

items.title: Indian Oil, Akasa Air ink pact to explore sustainable aviation fuel supply
items.summary: Indian Oil Corporation and Akasa Air are partnering to explore the future supply of sustainable aviation fuel. This collaboration aims to support Akasa Air's green goals and contribute to India's aviation sector's low-carbon transition. Both companies will assess potential SAF volumes, delivery locations, and timelines. This move is crucial for building supply chains and reducing costs for greener air travel.

items.title: World will soon run short of copper amid rising AI data centres, power demand: Economic Survey
items.summary: Economic Survey 2025-26 warns rising AI data centres and green energy will strain copper supplies, amid mine outages, trade barriers and volatile prices. Surging demand could keep copper elevated, reshaping metals markets, inflation trends, and India’s resilience through coming years.

items.title: Top Gainers and Losers on Jan 29: Hindustan Copper, GMDC, ABB India, Oil India, Vedanta, Gravita India among top gainers
items.summary: The Indian stock market saw volatility on January 29, yet key indices extended their gains, supported by a rally in metal and banking stocks. The Nifty 50 and Sensex increased by 0.25% and 0.26%, respectively, while healthcare and FMCG sectors struggled.

items.title: Piramal Pharma points to early recovery signs after seeing red in Q3
items.summary: The company posted its results for the third quarter of FY26 late on Wednesday evening, with its revenue dipping 3% year-on-year to  ₹2,140 crore, and slipping to a loss of  ₹136 crore from a net profit of  ₹4 crore in Q3FY25. Its ebitda margin shrank from 16% in Q3FY25 to 11% this fiscal.

items.title: Elon Musk is fueling Tesla by torching piles of cash
items.summary: Tesla plans a massive investment boost, doubling its budget for autonomous vehicles, robots and AI. This comes despite recent weak financial results. The company is also investing heavily in Elon Musk's AI venture, xAI. Tesla aims for future abundance, but significant cash burn is expected this year as it shifts focus from car manufacturing to new technologies.

items.title: Market Wrap: Sensex adds 222 points, Nifty above 25,400 as D-St recovers from early dip
items.summary: Indian markets reversed early losses to end higher on Thursday, with the Sensex and Nifty rebounding after a sharp morning selloff. Gains were supported by an upbeat economic survey and firm global cues, even as elevated crude, record gold prices and U.S.–Iran tensions kept investors cautious ahead of the Union Budget.

items.title: Gold, silver prices to remain elevated amid global uncertainties: Economic Survey
items.summary: The survey highlighted that both gold and silver touched lifetime highs during 2025, reflecting heightened global uncertainty and strong safe-haven demand

items.title: How may the US Fed meeting outcome impact the RBI MPC meeting next month? Explained
items.summary: According to experts, the Federal FOMC's decision to keep rates unchanged has important implications for global monetary policy, including India.

items.title: Gold price rise hits jewellery demand in India, volumes fell 24% in 2025: World Gold Council
items.summary: India’s gold jewellery demand by volume fell sharply in 2025 as record prices curbed buying, with consumption dropping 24% year-on-year to 430.5 tonnes, according to the World Gold Council. However, higher prices pushed the value of India’s jewellery demand to a record $49 billion.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 calls for education reforms to stem student exodus, draw overseas learners
items.summary: With 28 Indian students going abroad for every one international student who chooses India, the Economic Survey said the country has officially emerged as the world’s largest source country for international students.&nbsp;

items.title: DIIs cushion Indian equities as FIIs stay net sellers: Economic Survey
items.summary: FIIs have been net sellers since July 2025, barring October and November. Even in January so far, FIIs have net sold Indian equities worth  ₹36,771.10 crore. Meanwhile, DIIs have been net buyers throughout 2025. In January so far, DIIs have purchased Indian shares worth  ₹67,183.01 crore.

items.title: Sensex gains 222 points, Nifty 50 ends above 25,400— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today
items.summary: The Sensex jumped 222 points, or 0.27%, to close at 82,566.37, while the Nifty 50 settled at 25,418.90, up 76 points, or 0.30%. Mid and small-cap segments, however, underperformed as the BSE 150 Midcap index inched up by 0.10%, while the BSE 250 Smallcap index slipped 0.19%.

items.title: Digital addiction can hurt jobs, earnings and economy, warns Economic Survey
items.summary: The survey highlights the growing contribution of the digital economy, pegged at 11.74% of national income in FY23, which is projected to rise to 13.42% in FY25. However, this clashes with the negative impact it is having on the population.&nbsp;

items.title: Economic Survey views Sebi code as blueprint for regulatory reform
items.summary: The Economic Survey said the Securities Markets Code could reshape governance across India’s regulatory architecture.

items.summary: Margin compression appears sharper due to pricing and cost pass-through, but per-car profitability remains stable even as steel costs, export risks and valuation concerns weigh on sentiment.
